channel.title: Alternative hardware as target
channel.description:
Hi. Is there any possibility that the Axoloti IDE can be altered to address other hardware based on STM32F4?
I recognize the technical issues, and I'm assuming that's not your task. I also imagine that in the case a product became commercial, there might be business & licensing to consider.
Thanks for your consideration.

item.title: Alternative hardware as target
item.dc:creator: @GaryInThailand Gary Hall
item.description:
@GaryInThailand wrote:

Cool. Thanks!

I had seen that thread, but skipped to end where it becomes mainly about UI. So I had missed the point of the processing running on the alternat hardware.

Read full topic

item.title: Alternative hardware as target
item.dc:creator: @rvense
item.description:
@rvense wrote:

It's been done:

Running Axoloti on an Audiothingies P6 Hardware
I hope this is not considered subversive activity, but I've been spending a couple of nights getting the Axoloti firmware to run on an Audiothingies P6. While I have an Axoloti Core and will put it to good use as well, the P6 has the advantage of having a nice user interface and case ready made, so I feel it will be great for small synth or MIDI processor experiments. The modified firmware can be found on my github page (it's on the p6 branch of a fork of the main Axoloti repository). (It's woâ€¦

Basically you're looking at porting the firmware.

Read full topic
